titlestmt.titleproper: John Prescott Johnson Photographic Collection On John Edward Johnson 1917-1919
Johnson (John Prescott) Photographic Collection On John Edward Johnson
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by MarcEdit
titlestmt.sponsor: Conversion of this record was made possible by a grant from the National Historic Publications and Records Commission, an agency of the U.S. National Archives and Records Administration.

publicationstmt.publisher: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

repository.corpname: Oregon Historical Society, Davies Family Research Library

address.addressline: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

did.unittitle: John Prescott Johnson photographic collection on John Edward Johnson
did.abstract: 6 black and white photographs and 1 color photograph, 1917-1919, of John Edward Johnson during World War I, Caroline Prescott (Eaton) Johnson, a postcard sent by Caroline to John, and Henry Johnson (Heinrich Bengtar), John's father.

scopecontent.p: 6 black and white photographs and 1 color photograph, 1917-1919, of John Edward Johnson during World War I, Caroline Prescott (Eaton) Johnson, a postcard sent by Caroline to John, and Henry Johnson (Heinrich Bengtar), John's father.

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library before any reproduction use. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all of the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use may require seeking additional authorization from the copyright owners.

prefercite.p: John Prescott Johnson Photographic Collection on John Edward Johnson, Org. Lot 497, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

bibliography.p: Johnson, John Prescott. Dad : a remembrance. [Oregon : J.P. Johnson, 1990]
